clauses.text: (5) The Approved Schedule of Fees and Charges outlines all fees that may be charged by RMIT for enrolment or other engagement with RMIT.
(6) Eligibility for a refund is determined with reference to the Approved Schedule of Fees and Charges.
(7) Where a studentâ€™s request for a refund of fees is denied the response will state the reasons for the decision and advise of the right to appeal.
Enrolled students considering appealing a refund decision are advised to contact the RMIT University Student Union (RUSU) Student Rights team for advice
(8) Students who wish to apply for a refund or appeal a refund decision must follow this procedure and the processes published by the University Secretary and Academic Registrar.
(9) The following students can appeal a decision not to refund fees and/or the refund amount for courses undertaken in the first six months of study at RMIT:
a commencing international student studying in Australia on student visa
a domestic student studying an ELICOS course offered by RMIT University Pathways (RMIT UP) in Australia.
(10) Students must have received written advice of the outcome of their refund application before lodging an appeal against a refund assessment decision.
International students may submit an appeal in writing, within 20 working days of the original refund outcome being sent to the student.
Appeals will be considered by the following: for RMIT Vietnam, Academic Registrar, or nominee for RMIT University, the Director, Global Student Recruitment.
subclauses: for RMIT Vietnam, Academic Registrar, or nominee
for RMIT University, the Director, Global Student Recruitment.

clauses.text: Appeals are only considered if the student: provides evidence that the institution has made an error in process that has been a significant factor in the decision; and/or provides evidence that significant circumstances have not been taken into account; and/or provides new, relevant evidence that was not available at the time of the decision, which would have been a significant factor in the decision.
